intro: Malacothamnus clementinus, commonly known as the San Diego thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to southern California. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal climates. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, thimble-shaped fruits. Malacothamnus clementinus is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
